org.jdbdt

Class JDBDT

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdbdt.JDBDT

  • public final class JDBDT
extends Object
    JDBDT facade.

    This utility class defines the front-end API for database assertions, setup operations, and creation of associated class instances.

    Since:
    0.1

      • database

        public static DB database(Connection c)
        Create a new database handle.

        The given connection is associated to the handle. A reference to the connection can later be retrieved using DB.getConnection().

        Parameters:
        c - Connection.
        Returns:
        A new database handle for the given connection.

      • database

        public static DB database(String url)
                   throws SQLException
        Create a new database handle for given database URL.

        Calling this method is shorthand for:
             database( DriverManager.getConnection(url) ).

        Parameters:
        url - Database URL.
        Returns:
        A new database handle for the given connection.
        Throws:
        SQLException - If the connection cannot be created.
        See Also:
        database(Connection), DriverManager.getConnection(String)

      • database

        public static DB database(String url,
                          String user,
                          String pass)
                   throws SQLException
        Create a new database handle for given database URL, user and password .

        Calling this method is shorthand for:
             database( DriverManager.getConnection(url, user, pass) ).

        Parameters:
        url - Database URL.
        user - Database user.
        pass - Database password.
        Returns:
        A new database handle for the given connection.
        Throws:
        SQLException - If the connection cannot be created.
        See Also:
        database(Connection), DriverManager.getConnection(String, String, String)

      • teardown

        public static void teardown(DB db,
                            boolean closeConn)
        Tear-down a database handle.

        Calling this method releases any associated resources to the given database handle. The database handle should not be used after a call to this method is made.

        The freed-up resources include any save points, prepared statements, and opened log files. The second parameter specifies if the underlying database connection should be closed as well or not.

        Parameters:
        db - Database handle
        closeConn - Indicates if underlying connection should be closed.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A new data set builder.

      • empty

        public static DataSet empty(DataSource source)
        Get empty data set constant for given data source.

        This convenience method is useful to denote the empty data set for a data source. It always returns an empty, read-only data set, and one that is guaranteed to be unique and for the given data source instance.

        Parameters:
        source - Data source.
        Returns:
        A new data set for the given source.
        See Also:
        DataSet.isEmpty(), DataSet.isReadOnly()

      • takeSnapshot

        public static DataSet takeSnapshot(DataSource source)
        Take a database snapshot.

        The method takes a snapshot of the current database state for the given data source. A fresh query will be issued, yielding a new data set that is recorded internally as the latest snapshot for the data source. The snapshot is used as the base reference for any subsequent delta assertions, until a new snapshot is defined with a new call to this method or to populate(DataSet);

        Note that the method returns the data set instance representing the snapshot, but subsequent use of assertion methods does not require any book-keeping by the caller. Also, the returned data set is read-only (see DataSet.isReadOnly()).

        Parameters:
        source - Data source.
        Returns:
        Data set representing the snapshot.
        See Also:
        assertDelta(DataSet, DataSet), assertDeleted(DataSet), assertInserted(DataSet), assertUnchanged(DataSource)

      • assertEquals

        public static void assertEquals(DataSet expected,
                                DataSet actual)
                         throws DBAssertionError
        Assert that two data sets are equivalent.

        Note that the executed data set comparison is insensitive to the order of rows in both data sets.

        Parameters:
        expected - Expected data.
        actual - Actual data.
        Throws:
        DBAssertionError - if the assertion fails.
        See Also:
        assertEquals(String,DataSet,DataSet)

      • insert

        public static void insert(DataSet data)
        Insert a data set into the database.
        Parameters:
        data - Data set for insertion.
        See Also:

      • update

        public static void update(DataSet data)
        Update database according to given data set.

        The data set should be associated to a table with defined key columns. The key column values of each entry the data set determine the rows to be updated, and the remaining column values are used in the update.

        Parameters:
        data - Data set for update.
        See Also:
        TableBuilder.key(String...), Table.getKeyColumns(), update(DataSet), insert(DataSet), populate(DataSet), populateIfChanged(DataSet)

      • delete

        public static void delete(DataSet data)
        Delete data set from the database.

        The data set should be associated to a table with defined key columns. The key column values of each entry the data set determine the rows to delete.

        Parameters:
        data - Data set for deletion.
        See Also:
        TableBuilder.key(String...), Table.getKeyColumns(), update(DataSet), insert(DataSet), populate(DataSet), populateIfChanged(DataSet)

      • populate

        public static void populate(DataSet data)
        Populate database with given data set.
        Parameters:
        data - Data set for insertion.
        See Also:
        populateIfChanged(DataSet), insert(DataSet), update(DataSet), delete(DataSet)

      • populateIfChanged

        public static void populateIfChanged(DataSet data)
        Populate database with given data set if the associated table is seen as changed.

        A call to this method is functionally equivalent to
             if ( changed(data.getSource()) ) populate(data);

        Parameters:
        data - Data set for insertion.
        See Also:
        changed(DataSource...), populate(DataSet), insert(DataSet), update(DataSet), delete(DataSet)

      • deleteAll

        public static int deleteAll(Table table)
        Delete all data from a table.
        Parameters:
        table - Table.
        Returns:
        Number of deleted entries.
        See Also:
        truncate(Table), deleteAllWhere(Table,String,Object...)

      • drop

        public static void drop(Table table)
        Drop a table (table handle variant).

        A call to this method is shorthand for drop(table.getDB(), table.getName())).

        Parameters:
        table - Table to drop.
        See Also:
        drop(DB, String), assertTableExists(DB, String), assertTableDoesNotExist(DB, String)

      • deleteAllWhere

        @SafeVarargs
public static int deleteAllWhere(Table table,
                                              String where,
                                              Object... args)
        Delete all data from a table, subject to a WHERE clause.
        Parameters:
        table - Table.
        where - WHERE clause
        args - WHERE clause arguments, if any.
        Returns:
        Number of deleted entries.
        See Also:

      • execute

        public static int execute(DB db,
                          String sql,
                          Object... args)
        Execute arbitrary SQL for a database instance.

        You may use this method for arbitrary database setup actions.

        Parameters:
        db - Database.
        sql - SQL statement.
        args - SQL statement arguments.
        Returns:
        The value obtained through Statement.getUpdateCount(), after executing the statement.

      • save

        public static void save(DB db)
        Set JDBDT save-point for database.

        This method creates a save-point (through an internal Savepoint) which can later be restored (rolled back to) using restore(DB). Note that JDBDT maintains only one save-point per database handle, hence successive calls to this method discard the previous save-point set (if any).

        Parameters:
        db - Database handle.

      • restore

        public static void restore(DB db)
        Restore database state to the last JDBDT save-point.

        A call to this method restores (rolls back) the state to the last JDBDT save-point set using save(DB). The save-point cannot be subsequently restored, i.e., only one call to this method is allowed after each call to save(DB).

        Parameters:
        db - Database handle.

      • commit

        public static void commit(DB db)
        Commit changes in current transaction.

        In database terms the method is simply a shorthand for db.getConnection().commit(). Any database save-points will be discarded, including the JDBDT save-point, if set through save(DB).

        Parameters:
        db - Database handle.
        See Also:
        Connection.commit()

      • changed

        @SafeVarargs
public static boolean changed(DataSource... dataSources)
        Check if given data sources are seen as changed.

        A data source is marked as unchanged by a successful assertion through assertUnchanged(DataSource) or assertUnchanged(String,DataSource). Every other setup or assertion method will mark the associated data source as changed.

        This method may be useful for conditional setup code that is executed only if the database needs to be reinitialized, as illustrated below. 

         DataSource ds = ...; 
 
 if ( changed(ds) ) {
   // Setup initial state again
   ...
 }
        Parameters:
        dataSources - Data sources.
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the given data sources is marked as changed.
        See Also:
        populateIfChanged(DataSet)

      • dump

        public static void dump(DataSet data,
                        PrintStream out)
        Dump the contents of a data set.
        Parameters:
        data - Data set.
        out - Output stream.

      • dump

        public static void dump(DataSet data,
                        File outputFile)
        Dump the contents of a data set (output file variant).

        The output file will be GZIP-compressed if it has a .gz extension.

        Parameters:
        data - Data set.
        outputFile - Output file.

      • dump

                        PrintStream out)

        Parameters:
        source - Data source.
        out - Output stream.

      • dump

        public static void dump(DataSource source,
                        File outputFile)
        Dump the database contents for a data source (file variant).

        The output file will be GZIP-compressed if it has a .gz extension.

        Parameters:
        source - Data source.
        outputFile - Output file.
